Well I don't know much about anything, but I sure liked this film. In short, it was creative, humorous, simple, and heartwarming. Okay, since that's all you need to read to see I got the idea and you should go immediately, there is some back story as well. The hate-filled family we meet on the eve of preacher Stanley faking his own suicide seems just the kind to host some hate crimes up to their hips in blood.

I'd even say some shades of Hitchcock...this is clearly better than MMM, which is seen as a guilty pleasure by some if not most Woody fans.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was the title of the French film that became "Too Much Hate for Love",,, or "Get Out Of Hell Brother. Hate Is Too Bad", in different source material. No wonder "Too Much Hate For Love" seems to be the favorite title out of the three
